transcripts.text: Do you buy?  I mean, there's a history of the United States.  I know you were in the Marines, but there's a history of intelligence agencies just making stuff up.  Do you actually believe that Iran was hitting the tankers?  And Iran says that this drone was actually in Iran's sovereign territory.
Let's take that one by one, right?  So do you think this video right now you're taking of me is fake?
No, it's on right now.
Oh, okay.  So just like the Japanese tankers were bombed and it was on video, this video is going on right now?
But the owner of that tanker said it was in Iran.
And you believe that?  When we have video...
That's what he said.  To the contrary.  I mean, I was told we have weapons of mass destruction, that there was nothing behind that.
What?  What country doesn't have weapons of mass destruction right now?
I was told Iraq had weapons of mass destruction and was behind 9-11.
Did you see them not have weapons of mass destruction?
That's a double negative.  You can't prove a negative.  No, I didn't see them not have, but we don't go to war based on what someone might have.
You didn't see, well, you're playing Monday morning quarterback.
No, I'm just playing.  hundreds of thousands of people died.

At that moment in time, all the intel agencies were... in consensus that all of them said that they did have weapons of mass destruction.  Now you are playing Monday morning quarterback and saying that they didn't.  a whole bunch of years later.
They did come back and say that they were lying.  That's what they said.  They came back and said, oh, it was all a lie.
Remember, we got our media like you guys.  No, they apologized.  They apologized.  Our government apologized.  You guys should be on that side of the street.  No, no, wait, wait.
Let's get back.
Free ice cream.

Oh, no.  I don't like Biden.  So let me get.  No, no, but I want to give my audience.  I want to give my.  Wait, wait, wait.  No, but I want to give my audience an idea.  That's fine.  I want to get back to Trump, though.  So you like...

Somebody wants to get free ice cream right here, right now.  And that's the whole idea behind the whole thing.  Everything's free.  Somebody's got to pay for it.  There's nothing free in this world except for death and taxes.

You don't have a problem with us paying endlessly for war.  You don't ask how we're going to pay for that.  It's only how we're going to pay for health care, how we're going to pay for education.  It just seems like, and I respect your service, no question about it, but no one has a problem asking how we're going to pay for the wars.  Wait, wait, wait.  How are we going to pay for Trump's tax cuts to Goldman Sachs?

You're asking several questions and you're not letting me answer in between.  So one at a time, right?  The fact that we have to go to war, and that is a last resort, but the fact that we have to go to war sometimes, in our history, it has proven that we've been the winners of those wars.
But you're saying have to go to war.  We just talked about the fact that we didn't have to go to war with Iraq.
So if we didn't go to war in World War II, then the French, the English, and a whole bunch of other countries would have still been speaking German.
You're comparing Iraq to World War II?
And was there not terrorists in Iraq?
9-11 was 19 people from Saudi Arabia.
That's my answer.  In your opinion, it says that you don't agree that there was weapons of mass destruction.
It's not my opinion.  This is facts.  There was not.  Yes, the United Nations.
There was proof that they were taking weapons of mass destruction out of Iraq while the war was being prosecuted.
Where was that proof?  Where is this proof?
There's a video all over online.
Look for it.  On Alex Jones?  Where is his proof?  On Alex Jones?  On Breitbart?  Before you start asking questions, you should educate yourself.  I'm going to educate myself.
